title: Judges Openly Doubt Government as Justice Dept. Misleads and Dodges Orders
summary: Legal experts say the actions causing concern from the bench could have a more systemic effect, eroding the healthy functioning of the courts.

title: After Trump’s Firing of BLS Commissioner, Republicans Fall in Line With His Criticism
summary: President Trump’s decision to fire the head of the Bureau of Labor Statistics forced his allies into the awkward spot of criticizing an agency they had freely cited in the past.

title: Trump’s Deal-Making With Other Elite Schools Scrambles Harvard Negotiations
summary: The university was open to spending $500 million, but a $50 million settlement with Brown has prompted new debates in Cambridge.

title: University of Virginia Appoints Interim President After Ouster
summary: The university is turning to a former law school dean to lead the school as it faces pressure from Republicans in both Virginia and Washington, D.C.

title: Trump’s Demand to Trading Partners: Pledge Money or Get Higher Tariffs
summary: President Trump is using an “Art of the Deal” approach to get other nations to hand over cash to lower their tariffs.

title: Switzerland Rushes to Give Trump ‘More Attractive’ Offer to Cut Tariffs
summary: The Swiss government said it had “no indication” the country would be hit with a 39 percent tariff, which is set to take effect this week.

title: Jeju Air Plane Crash Highlights Decades of Blunders and Deadly Runway Wall
summary: The New York Times identified a series of missteps that made a Jeju Air flight’s catastrophic end much more deadly.

title: Takeaways From the Times Investigation Into the Jeju Air Crash
summary: Original designs for a structure at the end of the runway stipulated that it should break apart easily on impact. It ended up being made of concrete.

title: A Zoo in Denmark Wants to Feed Your Pets to Its Predators
summary: A Danish zoo is asking owners of companion animals nearing life’s end to instead donate them as food for captive lynxes, lions and other carnivores.

title: What Is Cardiac Amyloidosis?
summary: A quiet revolution in care is helping patients with cardiac amyloidosis, a form of heart failure that long stumped doctors.

title: Avoiding Ultraprocessed Foods Might Double Weight Loss
summary: In a new trial, people consumed more calories and had more cravings when they ate ultraprocessed foods.

title: With Texas Democrats Gone, Redistricting Plan Is Stymied for Now
summary: The speaker of the Texas House issued civil arrest warrants for lawmakers who fled the state to deny Republicans a quorum, but the scattered Democrats remained defiant.

title: The Origins of the Political Power Grab in Texas
summary: President Trump seized a moment ripe for another redistricting war.

title: Norway’s Hedged Bet on Europe’s Energy Future: A Garbage Disposal for Emissions
summary: A business called Northern Lights is seen as a model for efforts to pump carbon dioxide deep into wells, but high costs remain an obstacle.

title: How Is the Montana Shooting Suspect Still at Large? Check Out the Terrain.
summary: Many manhunts end quickly, but the man accused of killing four people in rural Montana appears to have disappeared into the kind of wilderness that helps elude pursuers.

title: Russia Says It Will Stop Abiding By INF Treaty
summary: The United States has accused Russia of violating the pact, which expired in 2019, for more than a decade.

title: ‘Clash of Trades’ Reality Show Aims to Boost Prestige of US Manufacturing
summary: This reality show is short on scandal, betrayal and tears, and has an unusual aim: Elevating U.S. manufacturing.

title: Trump Has Soured on Putin. Putin Couldn’t Care Less.
summary: Russia’s president has lost faith in the very idea of reaching agreements with the United States.

title: You Are Contaminated
summary: The toxic byproducts of human civilization are everywhere. Even in our bodies.

title: Chemours, DuPont and Corteva Settle $875 Million New Jersey PFAS Claims
summary: New Jersey officials called it the largest environmental settlement ever achieved by a single state.

title: Elizabeth Warren, Campaigning for Mamdani, Scorns Cuomo and Billionaires
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic candidate for mayor of New York City, appeared with Senator Elizabeth Warren to highlight his plan for free universal child care.

title: Bolsonaro Placed Under House Arrest by Brazil’s Supreme Court
summary: Former President Jair Bolsonaro, whose case has partly motivated President Trump’s tariffs on Brazil, was ordered to remain under house arrest as he awaited trial.

title: Tensions Flare Between Two Federal Agencies Charged With Aviation Safety
summary: A marathon of recent public hearings highlighted a rift over the investigation into the fatal midair crash in January between an Army helicopter and a passenger jet.
